website_summaries.verdict: Recording with an iPad just hit the big leagues thanks to the Apogee Duet for iPad & Mac audio interface, which offers two channels of pristine input and output.
pros: Stunning audio quality for both recording and playback
Direct iPad compatibility is thoughtfully designed
cons: Needs Lightning Connector adapter for newer iOS devices

customer_reviews.title: Apogee deserve their excellent reputation
customer_reviews.text: Apogee deserve their excellent reputation, the Duet is a well designed premium product which importantly delivers on sound quality. The detail and clarity this device brings to recordings and playback is remarkable. I thought I had a good set up before purchasing this for a small portable project studio. Looks like further Apogee purchases will have to be made. Fast delivery and prompt attention from DJ and Studio, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nillo

customer_reviews.title: Can't fault it.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant interface. Takes a bit of getting used to, but more than makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: George Gretton

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working almost a year to the day....
customer_reviews.text: Music gear is tough these day. I love this thing but it totally stopped working after 11.5 months. It starts up and then shuts off. Too bad. But $600+ for 11 month is unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: Lens Guy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I'm replacing a Fast Track Ultra which was ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I'm replacing a Fast Track Ultra which was impaired by the Mac El Capitan upgrade and seems to be a legacy product for its current owners. 90% of the time, this is an audio interface for some Fostex monitor speakers I bought. The other 10% of the time is to act as a recording interface. Easy to set up. Output sound is just awesome. Looking forward to some heavy recording sessions using my iPad. Very cool!
customer_reviews.author: Dotty

customer_reviews.title: Terrible software support - good sound quality though
customer_reviews.text: I'm running a mac with Catalina connecting an external GPU. The sound lags very badly with an eGPU, but it works nice without it. Overall the sound quality is perfect, as long as you don't face any software issues it will be a nice purchase. I'm still waiting for the tech support, otherwise I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: GuXinyuan

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy camper
customer_reviews.text: I did a fair amount of research before and after my purchase. I previously tried a much cheaper solution. The Duet is not inexpensive but it is so much better than my previous choice I am not unhappy with paying the difference. I had a reason to call customer service after the purchase. They were responsive and got me back on track in a heartbeat. Kudos!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W. St.Clair

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, clean, FULL sound!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the bomb! You don't know good your music CAN sound, until you try Apogee!! WORTH EVERY PENNY!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Global Chillage

customer_reviews.title: Gives Your Music That Big Studio Edge
customer_reviews.text: The Apogee Duet is a wonderful product. I've been recording for years and have sung on many records, commercials and films. Apogee was part of just about every studio that I've recorded around the world. To take that same technology and put it in a portable unit where now it can be used with the technology of today is pretty amazing. Today's technology with ProTools, LOGIC, Digital Performer, Reasons, etc having the Apogee Duet as a companion is well worth it. It will make your music 'radio ready'. I've done many duets in the course of my career, and I'm happy to now have this 'duet' interface as one of my studio companions. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Philing

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best interface for the money.. PRO Quality under $1.5k...
customer_reviews.author: Josse Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Pure Gold with Pure Vinyl
customer_reviews.text: I use this with Pure Vinyl Software from Channel D to record record albums. The 192/24 DAC produces stunning recordings of out of date records. Connected to a Mac Mini it generates Hi-Rez 24bit files of the individual tracks with metadata information that can then be integrated into iTunes if you record in AIFF format. If you like FLAC formatting then that is also available which can be played using other music software players that can decode that particular type of audio. I would not hesitate in recommending it if you are using it to record music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No lightning or 30-pin cables for IOS devices supplied in the box
customer_reviews.text: The duet for iPad, iPhone & Mac does not come with a lightning or 30-pin cable for IOS devices. These are sold separately.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Great interface
customer_reviews.text: Great sound capture with lots of volume, The meters are really nice and maestro has worked without a flaw, Easy to work with on Ipad as well. Don't buy it because of midi, it's just a USB port you might as well plug your midi into your computer.
customer_reviews.author: pontiacvibe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound & Versatility
customer_reviews.text: The Duet is awesome. It is a little big, but the sound quality is amazing. If you are looking for a way to improve sound quality to your headphones or speakers in a portable device, this is it! The versatility of the Duet is what sets it apart. You can connect your guitar, microphone, computer, or other devices and listen to the true quality of the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Spain

customer_reviews.title: Apogee Comes Through Again
customer_reviews.text: I have used Apogee products in the past and as always, they work flawlessly. An excellent product for pro studio recordings
customer_reviews.author: Michael Grady

customer_reviews.title: Solid Interface
customer_reviews.text: Solid unit with a very clean I/O signal. I use it to record both digital and analog signals from outside sources into my Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Snell

customer_reviews.title: Cannot play audio from Sibelius on my iMac/Sierra through Duet for iPad & Mac.
customer_reviews.text: Is it possible that there is no way to playback stereo digital audio generated by Sibelius, the most popular scoring program in the world, through a "Duet by Apogee", one of the most widely-used D/A converters in the world? Neither Avid nor Apogee nor Apple nor anyone who uses their products make this claim."The Avid branded Duet" is over twice the price of the "Duet for Mac & iPad" and is very poorly rated by those who have purchased it on Amazon. Please tell there is no reason to return this item.
customer_reviews.author: smullany

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects from iMac and Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Terrible user interface that isn't supported or updated by Apogee. No matter what I've done, it disconnects from the iMac and causes the entire system to restart. The best that Apogee could offer was for me to pay for service and go 7-10 days without an interface. They suggested that I rent another interface or buy a new one while I wait. EXTREMELY Frustrating customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Fonda

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and pristine clarity
customer_reviews.text: The sound from this interface is clean, clear and top of the line. I recommend this interface for professionals who are ready to take their sound to a whole new level.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Must have for musicians.
customer_reviews.text: A must have for musicians on the go. Incredibly convenient and versatile use.
customer_reviews.author: Seeno Shahrooz

customer_reviews.title: box was already runied and looks like it was opened many many times
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as new. And when i got the box, box was already runied and looks like it was opened many many times. I seen interface input that was already tried to put in and out. Couple scratches were found. Come on guys.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Amazon are selling old stock without the iOS Lightning cable
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this at the end of November but when it arrived it did not contain the iOS Lightning cable, just the 30-pin version. It's supposed to come with a iOS Lightning cable so that you can connect it directly to the latest Apple products. So Amazon are selling old stock without the latest cable.
customer_reviews.author: Fermie

customer_reviews.title: I would get something else.
customer_reviews.text: Compact. Looks nice. Poor product support. Software won’t work with Catalina. Decide will work, but software won’t, so can’t adjust gains and other important options.
customer_reviews.author: Betta Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible user interface and it breaks
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this, it was virtually impossible to set up to record without getting distortion. Lived with that and managed to find levels where this didn't happen. Stopped using it and then started again with updated firmware. Now no distortion at all but it stopped working after one day; only sending the output signal to one channel instead of stereo (same result with Audacity and Garageband). Nothing I did with the hardware or Maestro app or reinstalling the firmware again worked. Even A MAN (who of course was sure he could fix it) was unable to make it work. Overpriced garbage, I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Bellotti

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible customer service. Mine just stopped turning on after a failed firmware update, but Apogee made me pay $120 + paying to ship it to them, in order to fix it. They only warranty their product for 12 months, anything after that, you're paying for EVERY repair out of pocket. For such an expensive interface, you'd think they would have better customer service policies, especially when it's a failure of their device, and not due to water damage or misuse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was pretty good when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty good when it worked, but I had some drop-out issues that Apogee wasn’t able to fix without me paying to have it shipped to them and being without an interface for a month or so. I’ve had it for a few years, and it recently it failed altogether and now won’t turn on. I just bought an Apollo Twin to replace it. The Apollo is a little more expensive, but is a much better unit in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy this
customer_reviews.text: When it works, its great but I wish I had my money back. Constant pops and cuts in audio. I could never depend on this on stage. Reach out to support but they were unable to help. Sounds good when it's​ not cutting out. That is rare.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E.

customer_reviews.title: Good warm sound but slightly over-priced
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty user-friendly unit. Very straightforward and easy to operate. It has a pretty warm colored sound, which can be a blessing and a curse at the same time. Comparing it to my Apollo twin duo and the quality of its sound, this unit is slightly over priced. This unit should cost about 450.00 at max. I wish it didn't have all those wires hanging from it.
customer_reviews.author: Mastershopper22

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but no sound into several Macs (10.6.8 and 10.8.5)
customer_reviews.text: Made an attempt several years ago to run the unit and got plenty of support but no results. The sound from analog devices didn't reach the software. Sent it past guarantee and paid over $100 for inspection and minor repairs involving a power cord were carried out but again, no sound. Had I configured it wrong? Followed their steps and then inquired which specific details in the manual are essential as those listed referred to other software and their own Maestro froze on a high signal even when silent. Support wrote back saying they can't really determine which instructions are adequate and would look into it. I give up.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Evans

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been through about 3 of these over the past few years. They look and sound great but fail rather quickly. Not worth the price. These days, there are so many other cost effective options that sound just as good or better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zavala

customer_reviews.title: This company really has gone down hill!!!
customer_reviews.text: This used to be a fine company. I had a original firewire duet that I loved and stupidly switched to the usb a couple years ago when they offered a buy back on the earlier units. Nothing but problems. Constantly getting popping especially when the iMac goes to sleep mode. Often times the device shuts off for no reason. Used to be they had a customer support # now nothing but a slow miserable process of emailing back and forth with nothing but frustration and no results. Don't deal with these people. Get an Apollo instead.
customer_reviews.author: nick ramliak

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage breakout cables
customer_reviews.text: Good interface, terrible breakout cables. Worn out so fast. Can't record nothing. The break cables ($50) out of stock on apologies website. No way to order them.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Riddled with Issues
customer_reviews.text: This thing always seems to fail or have issues... I've had different versions of Duets for the past 12 years now, never buying one again. They're overpriced for such poor reliability. The Apogee software is super annoying as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Christenson

customer_reviews.title: The Best Interface
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Duet! The mic preamps/converters sound amazing on just about any microphone from an AEA R84 ribbon to a simple SM57. I primarily use it to record electric guitars and vocals, it's a huge upgrade from the cheaper interfaces I used in the past. The reliability and latency has been great as well. I'm on a 2014 MacBook Pro running OS X 10.10 in Logic Pro 10 and Pro Tools 12. There's a reason this box is an industry standard.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it's gorgeous, and yes, it has flaws (mavericks)
customer_reviews.text: Apogee- there's nothing more to say about audio quality and all that. But the drivers- well, they need from my experience. I'm on the newest MBPr on Mavericks and the Duet has issues with sleep, it has issues if you switch between apps (lets say from Logic to FCP and back, or to spottily). So I end up having to restart it which means yanking the USB cable which means having your monitors pop. Kind of wacky for a high priced item. Love it, love the interface, but it's not really turnkey.....
customer_reviews.author: BabyGiant

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: I mostly do voice work and this unit was an upgrade for me. The clean, crisp sound offers me the ability to sound just as good as those who may have spent more. I thank the Katts at Vintage King Audio for their help and suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: RANDAL WILSON

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and Useless
customer_reviews.text: I used to LOVE this interface right until I got a new MacBook Pro with Mavericks. I intended to use it for my Live Set but the drivers are horrible, making it completely unreliable. It will randomly restart, so it's a definite NO-NO for my live set up. I contacted Apogee but they were less helpful than a potato at a sandstorm. I will never ever buy an Apogee product again. I am currently looking for a more reliable interface to play live. It's such a shame because when it's working, it has one of the finest preamps, with beautiful, clear sound but you don't buy a BMW hoping it doesn't leave you stranded in the middle of the road.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Aaland

customer_reviews.title: Great compact audio interface
customer_reviews.text: I really like Duet 2. Music sounds crisp and perfect. It's compact and doesn't take much space on your desk. Very reliable pro interface for music and video editing.
customer_reviews.author: Uwe Schwarzwaelder

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this interface is great. Posted as a user of a MacBook Pro with Logic Pro X. The results are professional, Priced well, great form factor, portable. Huge improvement for my studio. Just works. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hinrichs

customer_reviews.title: 2 guitars and a small acoustic band with 3 vocalists - the duet worked brilliantly for all of these with just one large diaphrag
customer_reviews.text: I run this into an iMac with Garageband and record acoustic instruments and vocals. I've recorded solo guitar, 2 guitars and a small acoustic band with 3 vocalists - the duet worked brilliantly for all of these with just one large diaphragm mic. It is completely quiet and totally transparent. I am making professional recordings on this thing, selling CD's at shows, and it has paid for itself many times over in about 2 months. It was ridiculously simple to set up and use. I can't recommend this enough. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben B

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sounding device!! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best sounding interface on the market and in this price range. I have bought three units to have in a recording studio, so producers and songwriters can use them. The Duet has a solid build and runs on any mac we've plugged them into flawlessly. Apogee support quickly got me up and running. Simply put, if you want the best sounding A/D, D/A , and mic pre's, get the DUET!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Withrow

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is hands down simply amazing! I'm loving it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this Duet !
customer_reviews.text: This small little box sounds better than my old ProTools Rig ! As a songwriter/ producer I only record single instruments or vocals at a time so no need for a huge interface with tons of inputs and outputs. The sound is spectacular even if you just listen to iTunes through it, you miss it when you are not listening through it. I also have done several remote sessions at a singers house and used my iPhone 5S and Garageband, works perfectly !
customer_reviews.author: Meez

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with Logic on my MacBook Pro, everything sounds super clean and clear. Seems to be kind of the standard audio interface for Apple computers. Mine did come with the Lightning cable inside the box! I tried plugging my iPhone in just to test it and it connected right away, charges the iPhone, and starts playing audio from the phone. Very cool, love the look and the sound, and that it’s Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: SwimArl

customer_reviews.title: Nice product  - except the drivers...
customer_reviews.text: It took me quite a while to update the drivers and to get my system running. But once its running its a great product. Brilliant sound and perfect combination for Logic and Cubase.
customer_reviews.author: Der Chef

customer_reviews.title: The only line level inputs are XLR – get ready to buy a lot of new cables
customer_reviews.text: The only line level inputs are XLR. So, any balanced 1/4" line level gear will require an XLR adapter (or 1/4" – XLR cable). It's ridiculous – my synths. drum machines, effects processors all user 1/4" balanced outputs. Now I'll have to buy a whole new stock of cables. The 1/4" input is only for instruments, and microphones. The device has a breakout box, which I dislike – but it sounds good. The software and ergonomics are good, but that missing 1/4" balanced input makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: objectspinach

customer_reviews.title: but because of the above bug won't let me update the firmware easily. Might be worth $20 as a paperweight
customer_reviews.text: This product includes bugs such as this that they leave open for a year:  This is ridiculous. It randomly makes loud popping noises and changes the volume after updating to Yosemite, but because of the above bug won't let me update the firmware at all without buying an extra cable and installing an ios app (I use it on mac). Might be worth $20 as a paperweight, definitely not $600.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of hardware
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected from this Apogee, and it works great with Logic. The unit is an excellent DAC as well!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Egan

customer_reviews.title: Caca Grande - practice skeet shooting with this POS
customer_reviews.text: This thing is overpriced junk. There are so many better, cheaper interfaces. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: bhb

customer_reviews.title: Apogee is an amazing company
customer_reviews.text: The Apogee Duet 2 is an amazing soundcard for professional use with iMac/Logic Pro X! I started with the smaller Apogee One - also a great product. But needed more inputs. This Apogee Duet 2 is HIGHEST level quality.... Great mic preamps. Great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Sune Schack

product_meta.title: Apogee Duet 2-2 Channel USB Audio Interface for Recording Mics, Guitars, Keyboards on MAC and iOS Devices, Made in USA
product_meta.description: Style Name:DUET-IOS-MACApogee Duet sets the industry standard for portable professional audio recording. Made for the musician, producer and engineer that wants the ultimate sound quality and elegant simplicity, Duet features legendary Apogee AD/DA conversion, 2 world-class microphone preamps, USB MIDI I/O and ESS Sabre32 DAC technology. With Duet’s 2 combo inputs you can connect microphones, guitars, keyboards or line level devices such as external mic preamps or a mixing board. Duet also includes 4 analog outputs – 2 1/4” balanced outputs for connection to speakers or outboard equipment and a separate, independently controlled 1/4” stereo headphone output.
feature_bullets: AD/DA conversion for recording up to 192kHz / 24-bit.
USB 2.0 High Speed connection to Mac or Windows PC
Direct digital connection to iPad and iOS devices (iPhone, iPad and iPod touch. Lightning and 30-pin cable sold separately).
Software control of hardware parameters including input selection and low latency monitoring.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars48 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
